Description: Typical range for Nd:YAG lasers in stone cleaning to balance efficiency and heat control; starting at 100 W avoids thermal cracking in marble (CaCO3, low thermal conductivity ~2.5 W/mK); max limited to prevent decomposition above 800°C. Source: Adapt Laser Systems specs and Verho et al. (2007) in J. Cult. Herit.
Near-infrared wavelength optimized for Marble absorption and minimal subsurface damage
Beam spot diameter for precise cleaning control on Marble surfaces
Optimal repetition rate for efficient cleaning coverage and thermal management
Nanosecond pulse duration for effective contaminant removal with controlled thermal effects
Optimal scanning speed for uniform cleaning without excessive thermal buildup
Recommended number of passes for thorough cleaning with progressive contaminant removal
Optimal beam overlap for uniform cleaning coverage and processing efficiency
